properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 1 at 7:52PM CST until January 7 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Birmingham AL
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood
Warning for the following rivers in Alabama...

Sucarnoochee River At Livingston Affecting Sumter County.

.Heavy rainfall is expected over the next 24 to 48 hours and a flood warning is now in effect.
River levels are based on forecasted rainfall totals and river levels may change depending on
actual rainfall amounts...

The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the Sucarnoochee River At Livingston.
* from Saturday morning to late Monday night...or until the warning
is cancelled.
* At  7:30 PM Wednesday The stage Was 4.7 feet.
* Flood stage is 18.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...rise above flood stage by Saturday morning and continue
to rise to near 19.9 feet by Sunday morning. The river will fall
below flood stage by early Monday afternoon.
* Impact...At 21.0 feet...Overflow of low-lying acricultural lands
increases.  Cattle and farm equipment should be moved to higher
ground.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas.  Turn Around...Don't Drown.

Another statement will be issued by Thursday morning...or sooner if
conditions warrant.
